poem:
**Chain-Gang Dreams**

In the paper, I read about Nana,
how satire is his compass, his map
through our labyrinthine days.
The mind bends, he says, toward light
or dark, depending on the hour,
and I see a chain of words, each link
sparking, each page a small star
he guides me by, undepressed.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
